intro: Dichrotrichum concinnum, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and fine, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early spring, which are clustered in spikelets. Dichrotrichum concinnum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its habitat.
